thread.title: Notre Dame boys edge Southern Lehigh for Colonial League cross country title
thread.title_full: Notre Dame boys edge Southern Lehigh for Colonial League cross country title

title: Notre Dame boys edge Southern Lehigh for Colonial League cross country title
text:
Complete Box Score » 
Colonial League boys cross country championship -- Rapid Recap 
In a thrilling race for the team title, Notre Dame ’s depth allowed the Crusaders to prevail by three points – 61 to 64 – over Southern Lehigh and win its first CL championship meet title since 2010 on a sultry Wednesday afternoon at DeSales University. 
With pre-race individual favorite Joe Espinal of Wilson out with an illness, Palmerton ’s Zach Svetik took the gold in 17 minutes and 57 seconds with Northern Lehigh’s Gavin Kemery second (18:02) and the Crusader freshman John Koons third (18:04). 
If the times look off, it’s because they are. An error by the pace cart added perhaps as much as 2/10 of a mile to the race. Colonial League cross county chairman Bron Holland, the Bangor athletic director, admitted some extra mileage had been run but was uncertain as to the precise amount. 
Turning point: Notre Dame sophomore Charles Hohl passed two runners right at the end of the race to improve from 10th to eighth place, and secure the team win. 
Top performer: Svetik battled to hold off Kemery – two runners who are good friends – for his gold medal. 
What it means: The league may be facing another era of Notre Dame dominance as seven of the Crusaders’ eight runners are non-seniors. 
Brad Wilson may be reached at bwilson@lehighvalleylive.com . Follow him on Twitter @bradwsports . Find Lehigh Valley high school sports on Facebook .
